name: Math.abs(x)
content: There are some math calculations that require you to find the absolute value of a value, ignoring the negative sign. *Math.abs(x)* does not change the value of x, rather it returns the absolute value of x.

examples.name: Example: Distance between two points
examples.description: Use coordinates to calculate the horizontal and vertical distance between two points. This example also uses [Math.round](/docs/applab/mathRound) to display results.

examples.name: Example: Increments of distance
examples.description: Move the turtle a number of times at random, and keep track of the total distance traveled.

return_value: A number representing the absolute value of x, or NaN if x is not a number, or 0 if no parameter is provided.
short_description: Returns the absolute value of x.
